results.title: Growth of motor behaviour
results.brief_description: Short film in the Encyclopaedia Britannica series. Using Yale footage this shows motor or muscular development of a child between 4 weeks and 4 years through rolling, sitting, standing, walking and climbing stairs and riding a bike.

results.title: Growth of adaptive behaviour
results.brief_description: This short film shows the development of adaptive behaviour in a child staring at 15 weeks and going through to 4 years; mainly with crayons. Shows the child’s 4 year old drawing revealing the pattern of adaptive behaviour.

results.title: Group farming
results.creator_credit: Don Simmons and Australian Rural Adjustment Unit
results.brief_description: Considers the advantages and disadvantages of group farming. Discusses the issues involved in the sharing or pooling by farmers of resources such as machinery and sheds.

results.title: Greetings from Wollongong
results.creator_credit: Mary Callaghan, Nina Saunders and Steel City Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Wollongong on the south coast of New South Wales, the film chronicles a typical day in the lives of four teenagers. Faced with problems of unemployment, limited prospects and living in a city which is overrun by consumerist culture, they seek positive ways of constructing a life for themselves.

results.title: Greening out
results.creator_credit: Jacqueline Turnure, Robyn Silber and Midas Interactive
results.brief_description: Set against the background of music from The Whitlams, Alex Lloyd and Rumanastone, “Greening out” offers a candid view of teenagers and marijuana use. Teenagers in rural areas discuss what drives them to drugs, siting isolation, lack of things to do and depression. They talk openly about their experiences and what they’ve learnt from it. Salient medical advice is provided, with particular emphasis on how marijuana affects individuals in the formative adolescent years and how it affects your emotions and social interaction. Musicians Alex Lloyd and Tim Freedman also share their experiences with the drug. Cartoons intersperse the discussion, illustrating youth culture and drugs in action. Also includes interviews with Triple JJJ announcers Sarah Macdonald and Caroline Tran who discuss the pressures on youth today, and how they themselves cope with pressure. Dedicated to Chiquita Sturges. Suitable for secondary level students.

results.title: Green light for the traffic of tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Igor Scherb and Federal Republic of Germany
results.brief_description: Traffic problems in transport in Germany. Planning for modern transport arteria: phased traffic lights; traffic counter cylinder placed under the road surface to measure traffic density and automatically adjusts traffic light to govern traffic flow. Frankfurt has radar system to regulate traffic lights - the first in Germany. Use of television to watch flow and allows police to intervene in heavily congested areas - mobile radar checks to control traffic - construction of autobahn widening of existing roads.

results.title: Green
results.brief_description: Surfing set to music - documentary footage of professional male surfers from four locations across the world and featuring some 50 surfers. Heaps of slow-motion short-board action and a few wipeouts just to keep things interesting. Shot in Mexico, Australia, California, and Hawaii by producer/director Matt Wybenga. Some of the surfers featured include: Joel Parkinson, Mick Fanning, Andy Irons, Kelly Slater and Taj Burrow. Music includes artists DJ Shadow, Ziggy Marley, Single Handed and Coal Chamber.

results.title: Gourmet Fish Cooking
results.brief_description: This excellent video provides viewers with an easy to follow step by step guide to gourmet fish cooking. International chef, Peter Jarmer, passes on the tricks of the trade in selecting and filleting fish, cooking techniques and the art of exquisite presentation. Rated: G

results.title: Gold the sacred metal
results.creator_credit: Jeri Sopanen, Lewis Bushnell and Kena Productions
results.brief_description: This film is about gold and what people will do for and with it. For gold, the Conquistadors waged wars and with their superior weapons defeated the Latin American Indians. The film shows the descendants of these Indians, the Koguis, who still survive in small villages. Twice a year they dance with golden masks.
